<pre>	Ship Actions		Ships do not make regular turns, instead making a Strategic Turn during a Strategic Round that lasts ~30 Minutes. All characters choose what action they perform, Manoeuvre Action, Combat Action, or Extended Action(s) , These actions are then performed, first Maneovure Action, then Combat Action, with Extended Actions Occuring at any time. At GM Discretion the Crew of the ship can perform ship actions equal to their rating/10 (EG: Crew Rating 30 = 3 actions). Movements make use of "VU", or "Void Units", which abstractly represent roughly 10,000 kilometres, two ships may therefore be within 1 VU of each other.		Ship Crit Table		When a Ship takes a Critical hit from a weapon reaching its crit rating, roll 1d5 on crit table.
When a Crippled Ship takes Hull Damage, it takes a Critical Hit, select value on crit table equal to the damage taken.		Vehicle Actions			Those Operating Vehicles can choose from a number of actions during Vehicle Combat. These range from Attcks, to dodging, to special Manoeuvres. For Vehicles with Multiple Crew, the driver's initiative determines the order of all Crew Members in the Initiative Order, and goes first amongst the crew, followed by whoever had the highest initative immediately after. Each crewmember can take a different vehicle action, but can only make up to one Full Action. 		Vehicle Hit Location			Vehicle Repairing (Advanced)		Reparing a Vehicle requires Essential Repair Skills (Common Lore(Mechanicus) or Common Lore (Tech), or Forbidden Lore (Mechanicus)), Trade(Technomat), Trade(Armourer), and/or Tech-Use Tests.
Failing Test doesn't always mean repair failed, just means it takes longer.
	Manoeuvre Actions		Typically a Pilot(Space Craft) Test with an innate bonus or malus based to the ship's Manoeuvrability (Displayed as "Pilot(Space Craft)+Manoeuvrability Test").  The Ship must perform the basic manoeuvre action each turn and as such massive ships cannot stop instantly, it may however also perform more advanced manoeuvres. Failing a test related to an advanced manoeuvre defaults back to basic movement. Can only make one Manoeuvre action per strategic turn. Some Spacecraft and Flyers can also act as Skimmers, and would therefore use Pilot(Spacecraft/Flyer) + Manouverability Tests when in this mode.		Roll	Description		Repair Times		Repair Difficulties

Not all take the entire turn to complete in real time, but only one Extended Action can be made per character per strategic turn. Turrets		Void shields are useless against torpedos and Attack Craft, Turrets can be used against them though (must have at least 1 point of turrets):
- When an attacker rolls to hit a vessel with torpedos or Attack Craft (Bombers/Assault Boats), prior to it the defender makes an attack roll to shoot them down with turrets.
- Make a BS Test using the Crew's Skill Rating, with +5 per point in turrets. On success, turrets hit once, +1 hit for every 2 DoS.
- Each hit shoots down a torpedo or attack craft squadron, reducing the number prior to any attack rolls or boarding actions being made.
- Shot down torpedos are harmlessly destroyed, attack craft may simply be disabled or driven off, but otherwise can't participate in the following attack. Torpedos
(Battlefleet Koronus)		Torpedos Require a Torpedo Tube to Fire them, can only fire in Fore arc unless on Grand Cruiser or Larger, and ignore Void Shields. here's the process:
- Can fire any number of torpedos in tubes as salvo in "Short Spread" (+0 BS Test attack any ship within 1 VU of Torpedo),  or "Wide Spread" (-20 BS Test attack any ship in 2 VU of Torpedo, max hits is half salvo size). BS Tests cannot be improved by Explorer effort or shipboard components. If success, one torpedo hits, +1 per DoS. Don't combine multiple torpedo's dmg.
- Max number of torpedos fired before reloading is the Launcher's Strength. Reload takes one strategic turn, can make Extended Action and -10 Command/Tech-Use Test, if passed can fire immediately on same turn as reloading. 
- Critical hits applied if damage die equals or exceeds Crit Rating, if crit, does minimum of 1 damage and roll 1d5 on crit table.

Attack: Make a +0 Command+Craft Rating Test with +5 per additional Assault Boat Squadron, test can be made by commander on carrier, or individual leading the squadron. Success means a single Assault Boat Squadron breaches the hull, with an additional squadron per Degree of Success up to the maximum equal to the number of surviving Assault Boat squadrons. The Boarding Parties then perform a Hit and Run attack, ignoring the Pilot (Space Craft) Test and gaining +10 per squadron that landed. Afterwards, the Assault Boats withdraw with any survivors to rearm. A Character cannot both pilot the assault boat and lead the boarding Hit and Run attack.
